Topic.Title: Sound for gamebook works on my computer, but not on other's.

Posts.EditableText: On my gamebook, I upload a sound using the 'Action' tab at the top. I then click choose file and upload my sound file. When I published the game, I could play it with the music I put in, but on other computers/phones no music was to be heard. What am I doing wrong?
Posts.HTML: On my gamebook, I upload a sound using the 'Action' tab at the top. I then click choose file and upload my sound file. When I published the game, I could play it with the music I put in, but on other computers/phones no music was to be heard. What am I doing wrong?

Posts.EditableText: What is the format of your sound file (e.g. MP3/AU/OGG, 22K samples, etc)
Posts.HTML: What is the format of your sound file (e.g. MP3/AU/OGG, 22K samples, etc)

Posts.EditableText:
[quote="jaynabonne":14q9qptm]What is the format of your sound file (e.g. MP3/AU/OGG, 22K samples, etc)[/quote:14q9qptm]

I am using mp3 format.

Posts.EditableText:
[quote="awsomethingy":cxidjaa9][quote="jaynabonne":cxidjaa9]What is the format of your sound file (e.g. MP3/AU/OGG, 22K samples, etc)[/quote:cxidjaa9]

I am using mp3 format.[/quote:cxidjaa9]

Only Chrome, Safari and IE support mp3s and mobile devices don't support autoplay.
